update.description:
I ported a few fixes from pull request #81

- used new ray projection API 

- removed material ambient component

- add `Object3D.getDescendants()` in `three.compat.js` for backward compatibility

Here are some of the new changes I had to make:

- fixed grid rendering

- fixed sprites in radial menu for gzweb mobile

- fixed incorrect joint visuals axis offset 

- fixed bounding box geom

- fixed transform control mouse picking (ray intersection no longer works with invisible obj, so used invisible material instead)

- updated collada loader and tweaked texture loading.

- updated collada loader to use normal map by default if bumptype not specified

- mixed ambient with diffuse for a consistent look with gazebo. 

- fixed submesh loading

Known Issue

- Some collada mesh's surface normals appear to be flipped, e.g. `house_3`. The problem could be the mesh itself - more specifically, the fault of collada exporters from 3d modeling tools. I imported and exported some of the meshes using a more recent version of blender and the models rendered correctly. I'll submit PRs to gazebo_models to fix these meshes.
update.title: Threejs r86

content.html: yep sounds good to me.

content.html: @iche033 , what do you think of merging this and ticketing outstanding issues?

mm I can't reproduce this. This is what I tried:

1. launch gazebo with empty world

1. start gzweb bridge using `start_gzweb.sh`

1. go to gzweb in browser and open up developer console.

1. spawn a box, double pendulum in gazebo and see them appear in gzweb

but I didn't see the undefined pose error msg. I'm also on 7.8.1. Can you list the steps you did?
content.html:
mm I can't reproduce this. This is what I tried:

  1. launch gazebo with empty world

  2. start gzweb bridge using start_gzweb.sh

  3. go to gzweb in browser and open up developer console.

  4. spawn a box, double pendulum in gazebo and see them appear in gzweb

but I didn't see the undefined pose error msg. I'm also on 7.8.1. Can you list the steps you did?
